add.section: Create a new account to handle debits and credits with <entry>entries</entry>, ensuring it's assigned to an <accountGroup>account group</accountGroup>.

edit.section: Update an account with the latest information.

details.section: An account, functioning as a storage for accumulated debits and credits, constitutes the fundamental building block for <journal>journals</journal> and their respective <entry>entries</entry>.

account.section: An account, functioning as a storage for accumulated debits and credits, constitutes the fundamental building block for <journal>journals</journal> and their respective <entry>entries</entry>.

add.section: Create an account group to organize your <account>accounts</account>.

edit.section: Update an account group with the latest information.

details.section: An account group serves as the parent element for <account>accounts</account>, categorized as Assets, Liabilities, or Equity, aligning with their respective accounting semantics.

accountGroup.section: An account group serves as the parent element for <account>accounts</account>, categorized as Assets, Liabilities, or Equity, aligning with their respective accounting semantics.

add.section: Create a new branch to efficiently organize <journal>journals</journal>, <account>accounts</account>, <tag>tags</tag>, and more in an isolated environment within a specific currency.

edit.section: Edit the branch, and all associated elements linked to it will be seamlessly synchronized.

details.section: A branch, comprising <accountGroup>account groups</accountGroup> and individual <account>accounts</account>, acts as the transactional hub in a single currency.

branch.section: A branch, comprising <accountGroup>account groups</accountGroup> and individual <account>accounts</account>, acts as the transactional hub in a single currency.

entry.section: An entry, symbolizing either a debit or credit to an <account>account</account>, serves as the fundamental unit composing a <journal>journal</journal>.

details.section: An entry, symbolizing either a debit or credit to an <account>account</account>, serves as the fundamental unit composing a <journal>journal</journal>.

add.section: Add a new journal to the current <branch>branch</branch> to record your transactions. Ensure a balanced ledger by including at least two <entry>entries</entry>, with each entry having either a credit or debit to maintain zero values.

edit.section: Edit the journal to update data; you can also include more entries or exclude some attached <entry>entries</entry> as long as the updated journal remains balanced.

details.section: A journal, grouping multiple <entry>entries</entry> into a unified entity, is the most common way to record transactions, revenues, expenses, and more for a specific <branch>branch</branch>.

journal.section: A journal, grouping multiple <entry>entries</entry> into a unified entity, is the most common way to record transactions, revenues, expenses, and more for a specific <branch>branch</branch>.

home.section: Experience financial control with Pizzafund â€” your solution for effortless double-entry accounting. Tailor accounts, simplify entries. Learn more in the <about>about</about> page.

totalOverMonths.section: Total over months represents the total debit and credit of <entry>entries</entry> over 12 months, grouped by different accounts, account groups, or accounting types.

add.section: Add a tag to group your <journal>journals</journal> together

edit.section: Update the tag with the latest information.

details.section: Tags provide a convenient method for grouping your <journal>journals</journal> within a branch. They are also categorized to enhance organization.

tag.section: Add a tag to group your <journal>journals</journal> together.

add.section: Add a tag to group your <journal>journals</journal> across <branch>branches</branch> together.

details.section: A link connects <journal>journals</journal> across different <branch>branches</branch>, unlike tags, which are solely used for grouping journals within the same branch.

edit.section: Update the link with the latest information.

link.section: A link connects <journal>journals</journal> across different <branch>branches</branch>, unlike tags, which are solely used for grouping journals within the same branch.
